This review of the literature on Black women's mental_health has three goals: to expose the mental_health struggles, needs, and coping challenges of Black women; to critique the research, intervention, and public policy failures of mental_health professionals and Black women's groups to address the overwhelming needs of this population; and to identify lacking strategies by which community psychologists can attempt to improve the mental_health status of Black women through efforts to reduce their environmental burdens, to increase their resources and access to services, and to support their empowerment in American society.
